item.title: Protests outside Shahbagh Police Station after clashes
item.description: An hour of clashes between police and job seekers demanding a postponement of the 47th BCS written exam have brought traffic at Shahbagh to a standstill, while protesters staged sit-in outside the police station. Clashes erupted on Tuesday afternoon when the demonstrators broke through police barr

item.title: Bangladesh to face England, West Indies in T20 World Cup
item.description: Bangladesh have been drawn alongside England, West Indies, Nepal and Italy in Group C of the 2026 Men’s T20 World Cup, scheduled for February and March next year. India face their archrivals Pakistan in Group A. The tournament, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka, will be held from Feb 7 to Ma

item.title: Jamaat issues show-cause notice to Shahjahan Chowdhury
item.description: Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami has issued a show-cause notice to its former MP and central working committee member Shahjahan Chowdhury on Tuesday over his remarks on the administration. The notice, signed by party Secretary General Mia Golam Parwar, cited Chowdhury’s speech at an electoral resp

item.title: BNP optimistic about smooth national election in Feb: Fakhrul
item.description: BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir on Tuesday said his party is hopeful that the upcoming national election will be held smoothly in February next year. “We are hopeful that the election will be held in early or mid-February 2026 without any hassle. We are very optimistic abou

item.title: Fire continues to spread across congested Korail slum
item.description: A devastating fire has been consuming Dhaka’s Korail slum for nearly three hours, with Fire Service units struggling to bring it under control. As of around 8:15pm on Tuesday, numerous homes were still ablaze, flames leaping skyward. As many as 19 units, along with residents of the area, ar

item.title: France to give new impulse to bilateral ties with Bangladesh
item.description: The newly appointed Ambassador of France to Bangladesh, Jean-Marc Séré-Charlet, has expressed France’s readiness to initiate a new phase in its bilateral relations with Bangladesh, underscoring the strong alignment of interests between the two nations, particularly in the areas

item.title: BCCCI seeks Chinese joint venture investment in textile industries
item.description: Bangladesh-China Chamber of Commerce and Industry (BCCCI) President Md Khorshed Alam on Tuesday urged Chinese investors to invest in the country’s textile sector, particularly in sick and non-operational industries, through joint ventures. “Revitalising dormant facilities would yield m

item.title: 60 left-behind workers depart for Malaysia
item.description: The government today (Tuesday) launched an initiative to send workers, who could not go to Malaysia by May 31 last year, while as part of this programme, a flight carrying 60 workers departed here for Malaysia. The process of sending the workers who were unable to travel to Malaysia despite a long

item.title: Does the earth have enough to sustain our greed?
item.description: As we stand at a critical juncture in history, the urgency of addressing climate change has never been more apparent. Scientists around the globe agree that our planet is in peril, grappling with the effects of extreme weather events, rising sea levels, and environmental degradation. These alarming

item.title: Nutritional transition in South Asia
item.description: Because of a major shift in dietary patterns and lifestyle changes due to urbanisation and rising incomes, low- and middle-income countries are experiencing a rapid nutrition transition, leading to 'double burden of malnutrition', with under nutrition co-existing with obesity. The poorest populatio

item.title: Korail slum blaze tamed after five hours as inhabitants watch homes collapse
item.description: A devastating fire that raged for more than five hours in the Korail slum of Dhaka’s Mohakhali has finally been brought under control, while the air filled with the cries of residents who watched their homes collapse into ashes. Fire Service spokesman Anwar Bin Sattar confirmed at 10:35pm on

item.title: Why Savar leather park cannot go global
item.description: The recent findings about the Leather Industrial Park in Savar by the Implementation Monitoring and Evaluation Division (IMED) have once again brought Bangladesh's struggle with industrial governance, environmental compliance and export competitiveness into sharp focus.
